divs: sighting detailsi recently submitted a report of a possible abduction experience i had in 2005. i have become extremely interested in the subject of ufo's lately, and have been looking at the skies a lot. on september 2nd, at approximately 5am, i was outside smoking a cigarette and looking at the sky. looking straight up, i saw what looked like a star move to the south somewhat fast for about 2 seconds then disappear. i was very excited by this and grabbed my digital camera. once i got outside i noticed what looked like a large star at 30 degrees that was blinking red and blue. i took several pictures of it and a video clip. i realize that it is probably a satellite or the iss. i will include those pictures but i would like to stress that the pictures are not of the stars\balls of light that i saw. i went back inside shortly thereafter. at 6:30 am i went back outside to see if the red\blue blinking object was still there, it was, just at about 50 degrees. this leads me to believe it was a man-made object, although as i write this i can not find the object in the sky. i stayed out to watch the sky some more, and 10-something minutes later i saw another star-like object move and disappear. only this time, i saw the "star" motionless in the sky before it started moving. it moved in the same direction, south, for ~3 seconds, then disappeared. i was extremely excited at this point. i watched the sky for 30 more minutes then went to bed (i am a night owl) the next day at ~9:00pm i was with a couple friends cooking some steaks on the grill, i was looking at the sky for ~45 minutes before i saw the first one. it was the same star-like object moving through the sky for about 3-seconds then disappearing. i pointed to it as it was moving and said look, there's one! my friends didn't see it. then i tried something i had heard about online, telepathically communicating with the beings in the ufo's. selfishly, i asked them to show up, so my friends wouldn't think i was a nut job. well, at 10:10pm, i got my confirmation. this time it was more like a ball of light, the other ones seemed like they were at the edge of earth's atmosphere, this one couldn't have been higher that 2000 feet. it traveled south quickly (guesstimate 800mph) for 5 seconds then disappeared like the rest. this time one of my friends saw it who was standing up at the grill, and he agrees it "sure as hell ain't a meteor". my other friend didn't see it, he was sitting down by the house, which probably blocked his view. he really couldn't care less about ufo's anyway. i have tried since to get one to appear but i probably shouldn't push my luck. >>>>>note i apologize the photos and video are of poor quality, but they shouldn't matter anyway as they're not of the object in question, i just included them as they're part of the story. >>>>>note i removed the video clip i have ricochet internet and am outside the coverage area, it won't submit before timeout with the vid attatched
Summary: Ball of light shoots across sky and dissapears UFO?
